review: It's good when it is connected, but stops streaming a couple times a day with "connection with problems" showing on network status. I have to "forget" the connection and re-enter my password and reconnect then it's good for another movie or two before it happens again. I have a Chromecast and Roku stick in the same TV, plus 2 android phones that never lose connection to the same wifi router, only the FireTV stick has any problems staying connected.Otherwise it's nice, the interface is fairly smooth, the remote has enough range (barely) to reach my sofa (unlike the Roku remote that has a range of about 4 feet) and it plays Prime Videos and Netflix videos well. It's easy enough to distinguish between Prime content and stuff that costs money. I wish it could change the TV input like Chromecast does, and I *VERY MUCH* wish it had a volume control like Chromecast does. I use powered speakers connected to my TV, and don't have any remote for volume at all, so it's nice to be able to change volume using Chromecast and Roku, and it seems pretty ridiculous shortcoming to me to have a digital content player that can't change audio volume. It gets the job done, and the $20 I paid for it during the sale makes it worth having. If I'm playing something other than Amazon content though, I have other sticks that do a better job.

review: If youre an amazon Prime member this is a no brainer. Im a roku user, and this wont replace my roku 3 mainly because the roku 3 is so much faster at loading than a streaming stick. But this is great alongside. Now I can stream the Amazon prime music as well as having easy access to everything else. The games look fun for wasting a minute or two so Ive ordered a controller. Plus, like the Fire tablet, you can sideload apps...the roku cannot do that unless youre using a third party like plex which requires a PC/Mac connection. Again $19?? No brainer.
